recipe_description: Creamy and flavorful risotto made with assorted mushrooms and Arborio rice.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Assorted mushrooms (such as cremini, shiitake, or porcini)

instructions: In a saucepan, heat the broth and keep it warm over low heat.
In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender and any liquid released has evaporated, about 5-6 minutes.
Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until the grains are slightly toasted.
Pour in the white wine and stir until absorbed by the rice.

Begin adding the warm broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring frequently. Allow each addition of broth to be absorbed before adding the next, and continue until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente (this will take about 18-20 minutes).
Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Remove from heat and let it sit for a few minutes before serving.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and additional Parmesan cheese if desired. Serve hot.

recipe_description: These vegetarian burgers are packed with flavor and protein. They're easy to make and perfect for a summer cookout.
instructions: In a large bowl, mash the black beans with a fork. Stir in the cooked brown rice, corn, red onion, jalapeno (if using), breadcrumbs, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into 4 equal patties.
Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the patties and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve on hamburger buns with your favorite toppings.

recipe_description: Juicy and flavorful roasted chicken infused with herbs and bright lemon flavors.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rinse the chicken inside and out; pat dry with paper towels.
Season the cavity of the chicken with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with lemon slices, rosemary sprigs, thyme sprigs, and minced garlic.
Tie the legs together with kitchen twine for even cooking.
Rub the outside of the chicken with olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken on a roasting pan or baking dish.
Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until juices run clear and internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C) when checked with a meat thermometer.
Baste the chicken with pan juices halfway through cooking.
Once done, let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.
Serve the roasted chicken with pan juices and additional lemon wedges.

recipe_description: A quick and healthy stir-fry dish featuring tender chicken and a colorful assortment of vegetables.
instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and ginger, sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add chicken slices to the skillet, season with salt and pepper. Cook until chicken is no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes.
Push chicken to one side of the skillet. Add broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, and snow peas. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce and sesame oil. Pour over the chicken and vegetables in the skillet, toss everything together.
Cook for another minute, then remove from heat.
Serve immediately over cooked rice or noodles.
